The undrawn balance is the balance of the facility that has not been used or drawn down by the reporting party at the relevant date.
Off Balance Sheet Liquidity Support Facilities Other Undrawn Balance Amount

Report the undrawn balance of liquidity support facilities contracted by the reporting party to supplement its liquidity requirements.
In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
The undrawn balance is the balance of the facility that has not been used or drawn down by the reporting party at the relevant date.
Off Balance Sheet Liquidity Support Facilities Undrawn Balance Amount

In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
Report the principal amount of loans that are approved but not yet drawn. These are non-market related off-balance sheet contingent liabilities where the loans have been approved by the reporting party but the counterparty has yet to draw down the funds in relation to the arrangement.
The principal amount refers to the face value or gross amount of a given off-balance sheet transaction and not the fair value. The principal amount must be reported as a positive value, even for short positions in derivative financial instruments.
Off Balance Sheet Loans Approved But Not Yet Advanced Amount

In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
This is the balancing item in the list in which it is being used.
The principal amount refers to the face value or gross amount of a given off-balance sheet transaction and not the fair value. The principal amount must be reported as a positive value, even for short positions in derivative financial instruments.
Off Balance Sheet Non Market Related Other Amount

In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
Report the principal amount of all non-market related off-balance sheet transactions that give rise to credit risk exposures.
The principal amount refers to the face value or gross amount of a given off-balance sheet transaction and not the fair value. The principal amount must be reported as a positive value, even for short positions in derivative financial instruments.
Off Balance Sheet Non Market Related Total Amount

In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
Report the principal amount of note issuance and revolving underwriting facilities. These are non-market related off-balance sheet contingent liabilities in relation to arrangements whereby a borrower may draw down funds up to a prescribed limit over a predefined period by making repeated note issues to the market, and where, should the issue prove unable to be placed in the market, the unplaced amount is to be taken up or funds made available by the reporting entity being committed as an underwriter of the facility.
The principal amount refers to the face value or gross amount of a given off-balance sheet transaction and not the fair value. The principal amount must be reported as a positive value, even for short positions in derivative financial instruments.
Off Balance Sheet Note Issuance And Revolving Underwriting Facilities Amount

In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
Report the principal amount of partly paid shares and securities. These are non-market related off-balance sheet contingent liabilities in relation to any amounts owing on the uncalled portion of partly paid shares and securities that represent commitments with certain draw down by the issuer at a future date.
The principal amount refers to the face value or gross amount of a given off-balance sheet transaction and not the fair value. The principal amount must be reported as a positive value, even for short positions in derivative financial instruments.
Off Balance Sheet Partly Paid Shares And Securities Amount
Off Balance Sheet Performance Related Contingencies Amount

In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
Report the principal amount of placements of forward deposits. These are non-market related off-balance sheet contingent liabilities in relation to any agreement between an entity and another party whereby the entity will place a deposit at an agreed rate of interest with that party at a predetermined future date.
The principal amount refers to the face value or gross amount of a given off-balance sheet transaction and not the fair value. The principal amount must be reported as a positive value, even for short positions in derivative financial instruments.
Off Balance Sheet Placements Of Forward Deposits Amount

In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
Report the principal amount of sale and repurchase agreements ('Repos'). This relates to non-market related off-balance sheet arrangements whereby an entity sells a loan, security or other asset to another party with a commitment to repurchase the asset at an agreed price on an agreed future date.
The principal amount refers to the face value or gross amount of a given off-balance sheet transaction and not the fair value. The principal amount must be reported as a positive value, even for short positions in derivative financial instruments.
Off Balance Sheet Sale And Repurchase Agreements Amount

Report the approved balance of standby facilities that can be drawn down (funds accessed) within two to five days after notice is given by the reporting party of its intention to draw down on the standby facility (i.e. a two-five day waiting period).
In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
A formal standby facility or credit line is a formalised arrangement in which the counterparty has the right but not the obligation to draw down funds to a specified limit.
The approved balance of a facility is the maximum approved amount that can be drawn down in relation to that facility.
Off Balance Sheet Standby Facilities 2 To 5 Day Draw Down Approved Balance Amount

Report the undrawn balance of standby facilities that can be drawn down (funds accessed) within two to five days after notice is given by the reporting party of its intention to draw down on the standby facility (i.e. a two-five day waiting period).
In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
A formal standby facility or credit line is a formalised arrangement in which the counterparty has the right but not the obligation to draw down funds to a specified limit.
The undrawn balance is the balance of the facility that has not been used or drawn down by the reporting party at the relevant date.
Off Balance Sheet Standby Facilities 2 To 5 Day Draw Down Undrawn Balance Amount

Report the approved balance of standby facilities that can be drawn down (funds accessed) five days after notice is given by the reporting party of its intention to draw down on the standby facility (i.e. a five day waiting period).
In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
A formal standby facility or credit line is a formalised arrangement in which the counterparty has the right but not the obligation to draw down funds to a specified limit.
The approved balance of a facility is the maximum approved amount that can be drawn down in relation to that facility.
Off Balance Sheet Standby Facilities Greater Than 5 Day Draw Down Approved Balance Amount

Report the undrawn balance of standby facilities that can be drawn down (funds accessed) five days after notice is given by the reporting party of its intention to draw down on the standby facility (i.e. a five day waiting period).
In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
A formal standby facility or credit line is a formalised arrangement in which the counterparty has the right but not the obligation to draw down funds to a specified limit.
The undrawn balance is the balance of the facility that has not been used or drawn down by the reporting party at the relevant date.
Off Balance Sheet Standby Facilities Greater Than 5 Day Draw Down Undrawn Balance Amount

Report the approved balance of standby facilities that can be drawn down (funds accessed) on the same day that notice is given by the reporting party of its intention to draw down on the standby facility.
In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
A formal standby facility or credit line is a formalised arrangement in which the counterparty has the right but not the obligation to draw down funds to a specified limit.
The approved balance of a facility is the maximum approved amount that can be drawn down in relation to that facility.
Off Balance Sheet Standby Facilities Same Day Draw Down Approved Balance Amount

Report the undrawn balance of standby facilities that can be drawn down (funds accessed) on the same day that notice is given by the reporting party of its intention to draw down on the standby facility.
In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
A formal standby facility or credit line is a formalised arrangement in which the counterparty has the right but not the obligation to draw down funds to a specified limit.
The undrawn balance is the balance of the facility that has not been used or drawn down by the reporting party at the relevant date.
Off Balance Sheet Standby Facilities Same Day Draw Down Undrawn Balance Amount

In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
Report the principal amount of issued standby letters of credit serving as financial guarantees for loans, securities and any other financial liabilities. Report only irrevocable non-market related off-balance sheet obligations that carry the same credit risk as a direct extension of credit, such as an undertaking to make a payment to a third party in the event that a counterparty fails to meet a financial obligation, or an undertaking to a counterparty to acquire a potential claim on another party in the event of default by that party, constitutes a direct credit substitute (i.e. the risk of loss depends on the creditworthiness of the counterparty or the party on whom a potential claim is acquired).
The principal amount refers to the face value or gross amount of a given off-balance sheet transaction and not the fair value. The principal amount must be reported as a positive value, even for short positions in derivative financial instruments.
Off Balance Sheet Standby Letters Of Credit Principal Amount

In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
Report the principal amount of trade-related contingencies. These are non-market related off-balance sheet contingent liabilities arising from trade-related obligations that are secured against an underlying shipment of goods. This includes but is not limited to: - documentary letters of credit issued; - acceptances on trade bills; - shipping guarantees issued; and - any other trade-related contingencies.
The principal amount refers to the face value or gross amount of a given off-balance sheet transaction and not the fair value. The principal amount must be reported as a positive value, even for short positions in derivative financial instruments.
Off Balance Sheet Trade Related Contingencies Amount

In reporting this item the reporting party is to follow the basis that is used for the preparation of the annual financial statements in accordance with the Australian accounting standards. Actuarial valuations and calculations used in deriving the value of the item must be in accordance with prudential standards.
Report the principal amount of the non-market related off-balance sheet contingent liabilities relating to formal standby facilities or credit lines.
A formal standby facility or credit line is a formalised arrangement in which the counterparty has the right but not the obligation to draw down funds to a specified limit.
The principal amount refers to the face value or gross amount of a given off-balance sheet transaction and not the fair value. The principal amount must be reported as a positive value, even for short positions in derivative financial instruments.
Off Balance Sheet Undrawn Formal Standby Facilities And Credit Lines Amount
